RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Francesco Corona is a professor of Machine Learning of the Department of Computing at the Federal University of Ceará and a docent of Information and Computer Science at the Department of Computer Science of the Aalto University (Finland). He received the Laurea degree in Chemical Engineering from the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials of the University of Cagliari (Italy). After working as process control engineer for the Saras Group, he received the Ph.D. (Eng.) degree in Industrial Engineering from the Doctoral School in Industrial Engineering of the University of Cagliari. He joined the Aalto University/Helsinki University of Technology as a post-doctoral researcher in January 2007, in 2009 he was appointed the docentship in Industrial applications of Machine Learning and in 2014 the docentship in Information and Computer Science. In 2014 he joined the Federal University of Ceará as CNPq researcher in the Department of Teleinformatics Engineering and in 2016 he was appointed the professorship in Machine Learning and Logic at the Department of Computer Science.

Francesco's interest concentrate on statistical machine learning, probabilistic modelling, and information visualisation: Emphasis is on full-scale applications to supervision, control, and optimisation of industrial and environmental systems. 

He is member of IFAC, the International Federation of Automatic Control (since 2007). In IFAC, he is member of the Technical Commitee 8.4 on Biosystems and Bioprocesses (since 2011) where he serves as vice-chair (on industry, since 2017) and he is member of the IFAC Industry Committee (since 2018).

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Information and Computer Science

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DIAMOND: Advanced data management and informatics for optimum operation and control of wastewater treatment plants
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Nowadays most of the EU countries treat practically the totality of the volume of urban waste water (WW) generated. However, a deep look at the performance of most of the existing wastewater treatment facilities (WWTP) evidences that significant steps forward can still be given in terms of effluent quality, process robustness and operational costs.
One of the main technical limitations for optimizing plant operation some years ago was the lack of reliable measuring devices. At present, new and more reliable on-line sensors are available and the main limitation for the optimal operation of WWTPs is, clearly, the great difficulty to properly manage all the heterogeneous, incomplete and, sometimes inconsistent data of the WWTPs. WWTPs daily manage thousands of data from all points of the plant. The likelihood that data errors and/or faults occur has consequently highly increased. Also, unexpected situations occurring in the plants make sensors not fully reliable yet sending incorrect data to the data management systems. Using these data for real-time operation and control activities could lead to a drastic deterioration of the wastewater treatment efficiency. The appropriate processing and management of the data available in a WWTP nowadays exceed the capacity of the staff of the WWTP, limiting the use of the information available for diagnosis and operation tasks. Advanced on-line data fault detection and monitoring tools could alert operators from sensors showing unrealistic or incorrect data whereas, real-time data processing and adequation tools could make data more reliable. Project DIAMOND aims to achieve a model of excellence in the management of wastewater treatment systems by addressing the design, development, implementation and validation of new advanced data management, monitoring and control algorithms and tools for supporting the optimum operation of WWTPs. This objective is of great interest for the scientific and industrial communities related to WWTPs.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Nowadays most of the EU countries treat practically the totality of the volume of urban waste water (WW) generated. However, a deep look at the performance of most of the existing wastewater treatment facilities (WWTP) evidences that significant steps forward can still be given in terms of effluent quality, process robustness and operational costs.
One of the main technical limitations for optimizing plant operation some years ago was the lack of reliable measuring devices. At present, new and more reliable on-line sensors are available and the main limitation for the optimal operation of WWTPs is, clearly, the great difficulty to properly manage all the heterogeneous, incomplete and, sometimes inconsistent data of the WWTPs. WWTPs daily manage thousands of data from all points of the plant. The likelihood that data errors and/or faults occur has consequently highly increased. Also, unexpected situations occurring in the plants make sensors not fully reliable yet sending incorrect data to the data management systems. Using these data for real-time operation and control activities could lead to a drastic deterioration of the wastewater treatment efficiency. The appropriate processing and management of the data available in a WWTP nowadays exceed the capacity of the staff of the WWTP, limiting the use of the information available for diagnosis and operation tasks. Advanced on-line data fault detection and monitoring tools could alert operators from sensors showing unrealistic or incorrect data whereas, real-time data processing and adequation tools could make data more reliable. Project DIAMOND aims to achieve a model of excellence in the management of wastewater treatment systems by addressing the design, development, implementation and validation of new advanced data management, monitoring and control algorithms and tools for supporting the optimum operation of WWTPs. This objective is of great interest for the scientific and industrial communities related to WWTPs.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: DIAMOND: Advanced data management and informatics for optimum operation and control of wastewater treatment plants

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Information and Computer Science

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CHESS: Developing chemometrics with the tools of information sciences
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In the CHESS project, novel algorithms and variations of existing algorithms are developed for process data analysis, visualization, and monitoring. The algorithms are implemented in a variety of industrial applications under five test cases, including oil production, food production, process monitoring, plastics production, and environmental analysis and forecasting. In the first phase of CHESS, data sets from industrial partners were analyzed. Based on this study, the research partners have created a set of general-purpose information science tools. The emphasis is on real-time implementation of the methods in practical industrial environment. The final implementation of the methods and algorithms in products will be further developed by the small partner companies of CHESS.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: In the CHESS project, novel algorithms and variations of existing algorithms are developed for process data analysis, visualization, and monitoring. The algorithms are implemented in a variety of industrial applications under five test cases, including oil production, food production, process monitoring, plastics production, and environmental analysis and forecasting. In the first phase of CHESS, data sets from industrial partners were analyzed. Based on this study, the research partners have created a set of general-purpose information science tools. The emphasis is on real-time implementation of the methods in practical industrial environment. The final implementation of the methods and algorithms in products will be further developed by the small partner companies of CHESS.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: CHESS: Developing chemometrics with the tools of information sciences

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Information and Computer Science

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AutomAQUARES: Research on automation technologies for wastewater treatment plants in the era of data explosion
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: AutomAquaRes dedicates the efforts to the monitoring and control needs of three sectors within the water cycle: (1) industrial and (2) urban wastewater treatment systems; and (3) desalination systems. In the era of data explosion, AutomAquaRES exploits them in combination with modelling, optimization and control design tools to deliver novel products like software sensors, controllers, and data management systems. These products will position these sectors at a technological status in automation comparable to other industries.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: AutomAquaRes dedicates the efforts to the monitoring and control needs of three sectors within the water cycle: (1) industrial and (2) urban wastewater treatment systems; and (3) desalination systems. In the era of data explosion, AutomAqua exploits them in combination with modelling, optimization and control design tools to deliver novel products like software sensors, controllers, and data management systems. These products will position these sectors at a technological status in automation comparable to other industries.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: AutomAQUARes: Research on automation technologies for wastewater treatment plants in the era of data explosion

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Information and Computer Science

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AMBER: Assessment and modelling of Baltic ecosystem response
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The general aim of AMBER is the implementation and application of the Ecosystem Approach to Management (EAM) to the Baltic Sea with a focus on the coastal ecosystem (CE). The first step of AMBER is the separation of climate from anthropogenic signals in the CE by means of a combinatorial variation in model's boundary conditions using the output of existing regional climate change scenarios and the output of a watershed model simulating changes in land use. The second step of AMBER is the application of models for future projections. To reduce the problem of model uncertainties, the ensemble method will be applied. The resulting projections are milestones for the development of EAM tools.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The general aim of AMBER is the implementation and application of the Ecosystem Approach to Management (EAM) to the Baltic Sea with a focus on the coastal ecosystem (CE). The first step of AMBER is the separation of climate from anthropogenic signals in the CE by means of a combinatorial variation in model?s boundary conditions using the output of existing regional climate change scenarios and the output of a watershed model simulating changes in land use. The second step of AMBER is the application of models for future projections. To reduce the problem of model uncertainties, the ensemble method will be applied. The resulting projections are milestones for the development of EAM tools.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: AMBER: Assessment and modelling of Baltic ecosystem response

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AMALIA: Advanced machine learning and information visualisation for environmental systems analysis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The scope of the project Advanced Machine Learning and Information Visualisation Tools for Environmental Systems Analysis (AMALIA) encompasses the development and application of methods from Statistical Machine Learning and Information Visualisation on measurements from Environmental Process Industry. Emphasis is on Wastewater Treatment Plants, where the technological innovation arising from the project can be used in real-time monitoring of existing and future facilities and embedded in advanced control strategies and optimisation schemes. The project AMALIA is intended to concentrate especially on efficiency and trustworthiness through understandability of the algorithmic methods, which are believed to be the correct path to follow in order to advocate an ample diffusion of informatics and automation in environmental process industry.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The scope of the project Advanced Machine Learning and Information Visualisation Tools for Environmental Systems Analysis (AMALIA) encompasses the development and ap- plication of methods from Statistical Machine Learning and Information Visualisation on measurements from Environmental Process Industry. Emphasis is on Wastewater Treat- ment Plants, where the technological innovation arising from the project can be used in real-time monitoring of existing and future facilities and embedded in advanced control strategies and optimisation schemes. The project AMALIA is intended to concentrate especially on efficiency and trustworthiness through understandability of the algorithmic methods, which are believed to be the correct path to follow in order to advocate an ample diffusion of informatics and automation in environmental process industry.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: AMALIA: Advanced machine learning and information visualisation for environmental systems analysis

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Control4Reuse: Process control technologies for water reuse
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Control4Reuse aims at researching and developing technologies for managing treated water resources. The optimization of water treatment and reclamation systems in an integrated manner is foreseen as a sustainable solution to improve the reuse of this valuable water resource. The emphasis of the project is on the reuse of wastewater in specific agricultural and industrial sectors. From a technological viewpoint, the scope of the project is casted within a system monitoring and control framework, with specific activities ranging from the supervision and integration of sensor information/data, mathematical modelling of the processes and the design of advanced control strategies.
